title: What is the meaning and significance of numbers in Magnetism and Numerology?
first_phrase: In this text, we explore the significance and symbolism of numbers in the practice of Magnetism. The Tetraktys, a symbol representing the numerical values of one, two, three, and four, is discussed in relation to its representation of the properties of matter and the universe. The number two represents the material and movement, while three represents the three bodies of the earth, moon, and sun. Four represents the four elements of solid, fluid, gaseous, and etheric. Numerology is seen as a practical tool for understanding the combinations of matter and the cause and reason for all forms and properties in nature.

last_phrase: In conclusion, by incorporating the practice of numerology, music, and painting, we can better understand and operate within the harmony of the universe. The combination of various elements and properties leads to the diverse combinations that make up everything in nature. Towards achieving mastery in attraction, we must first work on our inner harmony, vibration, and energy.
